text: let's be honest South Beach can be a
little much of time but for those of us
who live around here no matter how jaded
South Beach still has an irresistible
Pole the rich the poor and everyone in
between still comes here to let loose so
in 36 hours
here's how to avoid the worst and enjoy
the best start with what everyone comes
for the beach one of South Beach's best
features is the elevated wooden
boardwalk that starts at 21st Street go
for a run or just a long walk to enjoy
the fresh ocean breeze as a reward hit
up one of the newer hotels for a sunset
cocktail at the Gansevoort South's
rooftop bar the views are spectacular
and the drinks unique pink elephants on
their cocktail list supposed to be one
of the drinks of the night so let's see
how is sapphire sapphire
then head over to the New World Symphony
for something a little more
sophisticated than you might have
expected from South Beach
it's a beloved institution an orchestral
academy known for mixed-media
extravaganzas one night free student
concerts the next then it's time for
dinner some of the best options can be
found just across Biscayne Bay in
Miami's Design District try for telly
Lyon for light fresh Italian fare served
in an upscale design showroom then
return to the beach in the dela nose
nightclub the Florida room before the
velvet rope becomes impossible or
expensive to penetrate
around 11:00 p.m. Miami native Angelo
lino and her band felt out funk and soul
if you're up for it you can stick around
to dance and the lounge becomes more of
a club or you may just want to call it a
night because on Saturday morning you
won't want to miss one of South Beach's
local gems beachside yoga for a $5
donation it's a great way to start your
day on cool winter mornings you might
even get a private lesson or like today
share one with the song and dance legend
Tommy tune when I have an important
performance coming up I try to steal
away down here we do it at 7 in the
morning at 5 in the evening so at 7 in
the morning the Sun is coming up as we
begin our day and in the evening it's
going down behind us over there so it's
like it makes for a perfect circle of a
day now you'll feel relaxed enough to
endure a few hours of shopping Lincoln
Road has all the typical brand name
stores but the best finds are used Miami
Beach's transient population recycles
their Gucci bags and Pucci dresses at
Fly boutique even a Sex in the City
costume designers recently paid a visit
the stylists that came in and spent what
six thousand dollars styling for the new
movie and if you want something spicier
for the club's head to beatniks where
you can find waist cincher x'
headdresses and lots of other
embellishments it's really kind of a
store for for entertainers so we'll
dress them up in all kinds of crazy
outfits after all that shopping you
won't want to put up with the beaches
slow excuse me relaxed service so head
to the cafe at books and books it's one
of Miami Beach's only bookstores and the
service and food beat the nearby
competition
of course no trip to Florida would be
complete without a little golf so after
a day of shopping stop at the miami
beach golf club to hit a large bucket of
balls for $12 as you hook your drive
toward the not-so-distant atlantic try
to imagine the view in 1928 when the pro
might be hitting golf balls off an
elephant's trunk you can even maintain
that historic feel with drinks and
dinner at the Betsy hotel ocean drives
newest old creation BLT Steak has taken
up residence in the lobby which means
you can order one of their famous
burgers at the bar or sit down for some
pampering popovers and your choice of
red meat in the dining room you and your
wallet won't forget it even locals can't
ignore the hot new night spots that
regularly show up in Us Weekly and these
days that means the Fontainebleau if you
can get past the velvet rope at Live you
might find yourself dancing with stars
like Jennifer Lopez or 57 if that fails
you can always enjoy the glamorous
atmosphere of the lobby bar either way
after a few hours you'll want to come
back down to earth go straight to Mack's
club deuce South Beach's best dive bar
where a game of pool and a beer cost
less than $10
your final few hours are here if you're
feeling energetic head to the newly
upgraded South Point Park try snorkeling
or fishing along the jetty or catch a
few waves with the locals or if you'd
rather relax and recover before the
journey home the spa at the standard
might be a better option get a massage
or lounge in the hammam then get your
last rays of Sun at their Bayside pool
before you're forced to say goodbye at
least until you plan your next trip
